pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.2: For the meaning of senāsana, see Appendix I: Technical Terms.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.9: For a discussion of these and those below, see Appendix II: Furniture.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.15: I have rendered muñja-reed and pabbaja-reed with the single word “reed”. I am not aware that these different species of reed can be properly distinguished in English.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.1: “Out in the open” renders ajjhokāsa. See Appendix I: Technical Terms for discussion.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.4: Sp-yoj 1.112: Cammakhaṇḍoti ettha cammaṁyeva ante khaṇḍattā chinnattā cammakhaṇḍoti vuccati, “Here cammakhaṇḍa is just a hide. Because it is cut up within and made of pieces, it called a cammakhaṇḍa.” For the meaning of cimilikā, “a mat underlay”, see Appendix II: Furniture.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.3.6: Sp 2.113: Kenaci palibuddhaṁ hotīti senāsanaṁ kenaci upaddutaṁ hotīti attho, “Kenaci palibuddhaṁ hoti: the meaning is that the furniture is controlled by something.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.3.7: “Emergency” renders āpadāsu. See Appendix I: Technical Terms for discussion.
